title: 820-00840 20v 0.45a no chime, no image
message:
This board had corrosion on components C7101, R7101, R7132 and tracks connecting to U7100
After replacement of above and  U7100 I have
0.95v on L7410/20/30
all_sys_pwrgd 3.2v
pm_sysrst_l 3.3v
put_rst_l 3.3v

Fan spins initially then stops then spins long time. Currents remains at 0.45a with SSD inserted.  0.36a without SSD.
No USB activity as indicated by snow edition stick.

title: 820-00840 20v 0.45a no chime, no image
message:
Very strange to get iGPU core voltage, but no CPU core.
Are you sure no voltage at L7210/20?

title: 820-00840 20v 0.45a no chime, no image
message:
0v at L7210/20
4.5ohm to gnd at each one
pp5v_s0 5v
ppbus_g3h_cpu 13.06v

title: 820-00840 20v 0.45a no chime, no image
message:
May have CPU problem.
Try known good BIOS, just in case.

title: 820-00840 20v 0.45a no chime, no image
message:
Just tried known good BIOS - no difference still 0v on L7210/20

How could a cpu problem explain why 0v at L7210/20 ?
Surely lack of voltage here means no power to cpu.

title: 820-00840 20v 0.45a no chime, no image
message:
PCH, BIOS and CPU are involved there.
Can also be other problem, like a simple corroded resistor...

[URL unfurl="true"]https://drive.google.com/file/d/1roFjzlTYrB0oRB5opnRaapdj7Rx2Zg7g/view?usp=sharing[/URL]

title: 820-00840 20v 0.45a no chime, no image
message: I trust I should reprogram the BIOS with that file with my CH341A [after unpacking]

title: 820-00840 20v 0.45a no chime, no image
message:
I have to say my 'known good BIOS' should really only be 'assumed good' as it was from another yet to be repaired 820-00840.
Worth trying a reprogrammed BIOS. Late here in Oz - something for tomorrow. Thanks
